p: We also asked how Arabidopsis recognizes Ab invasion to activate the CYP71A12 and PAD3-dependent postinvasive resistance. To this end we investigated function of BAK1 in immunity and ICAs formation and found that the two bak1 mutations, especially bak1–5, reduce postinvasive resistance to Ab, revealing the involvement of a PRR system in the recognition of Ab invasion for the activation of defense. Unexpectedly, we found that the bak1–5 mutation has no negative impact on the invasion-triggered activation of biosynthesis of camalexin or ICAs derived from Trp.
